title: Plan général de la Ville du Caire
creator: Grand, Pierre Bey
publisher: Le Caire, Égypte : Ebner et Cie
extent: 1 map on 4 sheets : color ; 57 x 73 cm., each sheet 68 x 86
description: The map includes avenues or  Percements through the fabric of the old city. The important religious monuments of the city, Islamic and Christian, were differentiated both by color (red for mosques, and blue for churches and synagogues) and notation (numbers for the mosques, and letters for churches and synagogues). The map identified a total of 282 mosques on it, of which nine were unnamed. . . . close examination of the 1874 map reveals that this document was a project and not the actual description of the place.  --- Arnaud (1993, p. 82).Arnaud, Jean-Luc.  Maps of Cairo and the Development of the City at the End of the 19th Century.  Environmental design: Journal of the Islamic Environmental Design Research Centre 1-2 (1993): 82-91.  In Archnet - http://archnet.org/publications/3273
subject: Religious architecture -- Egypt -- Cairo -- Maps; Monuments -- Egypt -- Cairo -- Maps; Cairo (Egypt) -- Buildings, structures, etc. -- Maps
source: From: Plan général de la Ville du Caire
